He seemed to think that the range of transporting say, a roast turkey, was limited to a few hundred miles -- so I told my instructor I could not only beam a bird from one planet to an adjacent planet in the same system -- which is no big deal anyway -- but if I were so inclined I could actually do it with a lifeform! direction.raw_text: Father...? Sarek turns -- but IT ISN'T SAREK.   IT'S SPOCK PRIME.     Who says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am not... our father. An incredible beat, our two Spocks in eye lock... both minds processing conversational possibilities at an incredible rate... surreal extensions of each other, separate but connected...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Fascinating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are so few Vulcans left.    We cannot afford to ignore each other. Young Spock's eyes flicker in puzzlement...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why did you send Kirk aboard when you alone could've explained the truth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat, simply) Because you needed each other. Opposing yet complimentary opposites. It was that balance between us -- I should say you and Kirk -- that often made the impossible, possible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... it was a test?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm in no position to pass judgment... my actions have robbed you of much. I could not also deprive you the revelation of all you can accomplish together... of a friendship that will define you both in ways you cannot yet realize. There is, to young Spock's surprise, vulnerability in that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you persuade him to keep your secret?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I inferred universe-ending paradoxes would ensue should he break his promise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You lied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I implied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A gamble...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An act of faith. One I hope you'll repeat in the future. Young Spock considers an enduring friendship between him and Kirk... for the first time, understanding it. But -- SPOCK The future's not what it used to be... in the face of extinction, it's only logical I resign my Starfleet commission and help rebuild our race.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And yet, you are in a unique position... you can be in two places at once. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) I urge you to remain in Starfleet: I've already located a suitable planet on which to establish a Vulcan colony, and assist in the foundation of a new science academy. Young Spock takes that in, resolute...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My future cannot be determined by your past. We are one, but not the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I ask that you do yourself a favor. Put away logic. Do what feels right. The world you've inherited lives in the shadow of incalculable devastation... but there's no reason you must face it alone. Spock Prime moves to the door, stops.    Offers the VULCAN SALUTE:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As my customary farewell would appear oddly self serving, I will simply say... good luck. Their eyes hold. Spock turns, disappearing into the corridor. direction.raw_text: Your inspirational valor and supreme dedication to your comrades are in keeping with the highest traditions of service and reflect utmost credit to yourself, your crew, and the Federation. For your... unique solution to the Kobayashi Maru, it's my honor to award you with a commendation for original thinking. He opens a BOX -- glorious in repose, a MEDAL:

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enterprise, for duty as his relief. Kirk turns. Walks to... PIKE. In a wheelchair now, wearing an ADMIRAL'S UNIFORM. Overnight, his hair's turned totally grey -- but despite his trauma, his pride's overwhelming. They SALUTE:

direction.raw_text: I relieve you, Sir.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Sir. Kirk turns to the crowd. Eyes shining. WILD APPLAUSE. As Kirk rejoins his crew for hugs and congratulations, we go to the BACK of the hangar... SPOCK PRIME. direction.raw_text: Same ship, different day. And Kirk pauses. His eyes go over to the empty science console with a sense of incompleteness. In fact, everyone on the bridge feels it. A bitter truth they'll have to accept.
